properties.name: AI Custom Object - Game over screen

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: GameOver_Screen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Game over screen to place over a game when it has finished to display information and change the game scene.
description: An object that you create in the game when the player dies, runs out of time, or wins the game.

Regardless of where the object is created, it will cover the entire game screen automatically when created and provides the player with a button to press to change the scene in the game. The object text, button text, victory state, and scene that will be transitioned to can all be changed through events.

eventsBasedObjects.description:
Game over screen object with a button that can be pressed to set/reset the game scene. It automatically moves itself to the center of the screen with a darkening layer behind it. Create the object with the normal create an object action, and set the layer you wish the object to appear.

Create a game over object that will set/reset the game scene.
eventsBasedObjects.name: GameOver_Screen

eventsFunctions.description: the scene the game will return to when restart is pressed on game over screen.

eventsFunctions.description: the text displayed on the game over screen return scene button.

propertyDescriptors.label: The scene the game will return to.
propertyDescriptors.description: This property stores the scene name that the game will transition to when the return scene button is pressed.

propertyDescriptors.label: The text displayed on the return scene button.
propertyDescriptors.description: This property stores the text that will be displayed on the return scene button.
propertyDescriptors.name: ButtonText

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TweenIntoView
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Tween object into position from off screen, to create a polished visual effect.
description: Tween UI objects into position from off screen, or from a set position, to create a polished visual effect.

When the object is first created in the game scene, or if they exist at the beginning of the scene, they will be moved a set distance from where they were originally placed, and tween back to the position over a set duration.
Create the object to tween it into the game scene, and use the "TweenOut" action to tween the object back in the direction it came from, and delete the object when the tween ends.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Tween UI objects into position from off screen, to create a polished visual effect.

propertyDescriptors.label: Manually set the distance to of the tween
propertyDescriptors.description: Leave this value at 0 to tween the object in from outside of the screen.

propertyDescriptors.label: Tween in the object when first created
propertyDescriptors.description: If unchecked, the object will be created offscreen, and the TweenIn action will need to be used.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.

eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
